oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Various Artist Promos - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Multiple recordings of artist excerpts from Biff Collie's (entertainer) Music City Album Review. Recordings include excerpts from Lionel Cartwright (performer), Don Williams (performer), Holly Dunn (performer), T. G. Brown (performer), Cee Cee Chapman (performer), the Forester Sisters (performance group), the Desert Rose Band (performance group), Earl Thomas Conley (performer), Clint Black (performer), Kathy Mattea (performer), Patty Loveless (performer), Lacy J. Dalton (performer), Johnny Rodriquez (performer), Vern Gosdin (performer), Eddy Raven (performer), Billy Joe Royal (performer), Foster & Lloyd (performance group), John Conlee (performer), Mickey Gilley (performer), Restless Heart (performance group), Jo-El Sonnier (performer), Ronnie McDowell (performer), Mel McDaniel (performer), Moe Bandy (performer), Skip Ewing (performer), Dan Seals (performer), Larry Gatlin (performer), Baillie and the Boys (performance group), Suzy Bogguss (performer), Shenandoah (performer), Garth Brooks (performer), Tanya Tucker (performer), and the Burch Sisters (performance group).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Various one word responses from Lionel Cartwright -- (00:22) Cartwright says the person he can listen to, more than anyone else, is Ray Charles -- (00:39) Cartwright radio spot introduction to "Heart Broke" -- (00:53) Cartwright comments on the Everly Brothers and introduces "Bye bye Love" -- (01:29) Cartwright comments on Merle Haggard and introduces "Mama Tried" -- (01:50) Cartwright introduces Emmylou Harris' "IF I Could Only Win Your Love" -- (02:10) Cartwright excerpt [incomplete] -- (02:20) Cartwright says Grandpa Jones was the first musical act he saw, and Cartwright discusses Buck Owens -- (03:16) Cartwright says he is a fan of Tom T.
